intro: Gonufas paniculata, commonly known as the panicled gonufas, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions. It is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. The plant belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. Its growth habit is typically herbaceous, with upright stems that can reach several feet in height. The flowers are often arranged in panicles, giving the plant its common name.
